Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0ner1974
Reviews.Content: We were a group of several people so saw a variety of rooms in the esablishment. I was fortunate enough to have the suite, which was spacious with a balcony on the third floor. The draw back to this room is that the terrace restaurant is right above you and the walls and roof are thin. You can hear the chairs dragging above you...on top of the howeling stray cats, barking dogs and frequent trains. My mother and sisters room had wall paper coming off the walls, black mold in the shower and a foul smell emitting from "somewhere". There are nicer places to stay...so I would avoid this one. The view from the Terrace restaurant where breakfast was served was beautiful. Had we not stayed in another botique hotel in Old Town just a few days prior that was far superior perhaps this one wouldn't have been such a let down.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: joanc1992
Reviews.Content: I can't really say anything but FANTASTIC about this hotel! The service offered by Erdal and the rest of the staff was outstanding, always friendly and warmly inviting, always helpful, even when it was very late/early. They helped me get to and from the airport with a minimum of hassle, which was great since my outbound flight was quite early. First thing on arrival Erdal gave me a map with the location of all the nearby sights and amenities (e.g, pharmacy and ATM). So I was ready to roll right away! I was traveling solo, so I received one of the smaller rooms on a lower floor, which was fine since I was literally only in the room to sleep! Even so, the room and bath were both quite adequate in size. There was even a mini-fridge in the room, so I could keep small amounts of my own drinks etc there. The bathroom had a towel warmer so if you did any hand laundry it would dry easily and quickly. Shampoo was provided; the showers were nice and hot (which was welcome after a cool damp March day!). There was also a safe in the wardrobe within the room, so you could leave extra cash, or your passport, or other valuables safe. The breakfast was just wonderful, thick yogurt, cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, feta cheese, other cheeses, halvah, figs, apricots, raisins, nuts, some slightly sweet biscuits (which I could not get enough of!). Plus, served on the rooftop patio/sunroom, making it an enjoyable experience year round. I just wanted to sit and drink coffee all morning there, but got myself moving and out to see the city! I still dream of that breakfast though! There were great unobstructed views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara from the sunroom, which provided a great location for some nighttime photos of the mosque. The location of the hotel can't be beat....a 5 min walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. It was almost too good to be true! I have never in my travels had such a great hotel room, so close to the local sights, at such a reasonable price. I've been raving about this hotel for the last 3 days to anyone who would listen.

Reviews.Title: “The warmth of the service and the magic of the location!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravelingMind
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a fantastic four nights in Istanbul at this establishment. I am compelled to comment first and most enthusiastically about the service. Erdal, the manager, was quite possibly the warmest host I have ever encountered at a hotel. This man is genuinely in the right business!! He was bright, generous, genuinely concerned about our happiness, and quick to laugh. Abdullah, the second gentleman to staff the desk, was also very personable and truly interested in the quality of our stay. Hilmiye staffed the restaurant (among other roles) and always made sure we had a great breakfast! All three fashioned a great resource to make our stay 100% fantastic. This is a great team. The location of the hotel, it could be argued, was effectively perfect. While its just being in the old city already makes this true, the hotel's location within this area -- a quieter but fantastically convenient street -- made it even better. We had a magnificent city at our feet! We stayed in two rooms while at this hotel. The first night was spent in one of the smaller rooms on the second floor which one might find a little tight if one is used to conventional Western/North American rooms. The remaining nights were spend in the Dolmabahce Suite (top floor, overlooking the Strait), a genuinely great room. The beds were comfy, the water was hot, and the view was perfect. The all important question: Would we stay here again? Absolutely an unqualified yes. Thank you, folks, you gave us memories which will last a lifetime! Bonus: Make sure you take the time to enjoy the finches!!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul in the snow.”
Reviews.Author: alsation
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel as a package with Easy Jet. Researched on Trip advisor and found that the hotel was everything previous people had said. Had the 3 bedroom in the eaves. Large, warm, clean and comfortable. Was aware that there was no lift so climbing up the 3 flights of stairs helped to improve the fitness levels. On the plus side there was only one flight of stairs to the roof terrece to have breakfast. We certainly had one of the best views of the Blue Mosque, and of the Bosphorous, well when it wasn't snowing!!! Staff helpful, we were quite happy to use the tram, vernicular railway and bus service. We will happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pgauchat
Reviews.Content: Erdal, the manager, is incredibly helpful and accommodating. The hotel is charming and a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia. Breakfast is included and is served on a rooftop with amazing views of the Bosphorous. To be clear, the whole Sultanahmet district is focused on tourism and the restaurants and hotels in the area all cater to foreigners. Having said this, we felt very safe walking at night and you can access the entire city from this location using public or private transportation. My one suggestion would be that, if you are going to take a taxi in Istanbul, you are best served to ask the hotel to arrange for one.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i have ever stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: Gustochh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sotuated on the main area and so close the every domestic places ( hipedrom, topkapi palace, hagia sophia, blue mosque etc. ) the staff was so friendly and helpful they tried to make their best for any kind of my questions, thanks for all.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Center of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Danielle P
Reviews.Content: Our experiences at the Romantic Hotel were great. The staff, especially Erdal who has the night shift, were warm and welcoming and ready to meet every need. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts (included) on the roof with an amazing 360 degree view of the Bosphorous, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. This hotel is in short walking distance from many of the ancient sites as well as the tram line that runs to the New District. The room, while small, was totally clean and quiet. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is a budget traveler who appreciates excellent service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philippe F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely ottoman old house renovated. The location is extremely close to the ancient Istambul, at 5 mins from all the best sites to visit. The kindness of the hotel staff is fabulous, the quality of the advises given is excellent. We went there with our 2 daughters, we first sleep in the family room with one queen bed in one part of the room and 2 single beds in the other part of the room. Both rooms are separated. The 4 other nights were spent in the "purple room" (2 single bed) and in another queen double room with nice view on the Bosphore and the Marmara sea. The hotel has a free wifi at each levels, including the terrasse with a dramatic view on the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the Bosphore. It was so lovely to have a nice breakfast here. Normal rooms are relatively small but so cute and cozy. We really wish to come back again here and I highly recommand this hotel. Thanks again to the staff for these 5 lovely days.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD POSITION FOR TOURING HISTORIC ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: travellerjunorm
Reviews.Content: The romantic Hotel is well positioned (in the Sultanahmet district). For a 4/5 day trip it means that all the best sites (Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia, Bosphorous, etc) are either within walking distance or else only a short (and cheap) tram ride away (2YTL). Many good restaurants close by. The hotel is classically furnished which masks a fair amount of its worn out furnishings. We had a room on the first floor which, when the two single beds were put together by the hotel to make a double, left very little room to walk round the room. The hotel was always clean and the breakfast very good. Buffet style and good quality. Room had a balcony and a reasonable view of the Bosphorous but a railway line was at the back of the hotel. Not good for light sleepers. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and gave us a good orientation briefing on arrival. Overall a good hotel. We paid around 107Euros per night which was a little expensive, but in this location in this booming city/country, was to be expected. Airport transfers no problem. Ataturk can be reached by the Istanbul Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of old city but very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Chickory0
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Very central in the old city but very quiet in room. Easy walk to all the sights - Topki, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and more. Very helpful staff. Free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lexydani1
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Romantic Hotel recently. This is an old converted Ottoman mansion which is in a fantastic location with a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and all the historic sites and the Sultanahmet tram stop. That being said, the hotel itself is average. We had a very small room, similar to a cruise cabin in size. I believe all the rooms are slightly different, we might have had the smallest room though. The bathroom was tiny as well and again the shower reminded me of a cruise shower- tiny ( if you drop the soap, you are bound to hit some part of your body in an effort of bending to pick it up). I am not overweight and am only 5' 2. I can't imagine what would happen if you are a bigger person. We were on the first floor and were thankful for that as the hotel doesn't have an elevator and the stairs are very steep. The rooms are decorated in Turkish fashion, not my taste, but everything was clean and functional. Air conditioning worked, but leaked on the floor a bit ( nothing crazy), but we did bring it up to reception one eve, and were told tat someone would check it out in am, but was never followed through. Since we brought it up once, but never taken care of and really wasn't a huge issue for us, we did not bother to mention it again. I have to say that if you are person that uses a blow drier on a regular basis BRING YOU OWN!. This hotel has the worst blow dryer I have ever used. It doesn't stay on( energy saving?) and you have to keep the button pressed down the whole time, except the button is very poorly positioned and your wrist is at an odd angle the whole time. My other complaint is the balcony, which could have been a a lot nicer and an extension of the room. There were 2 chairs and a table, but that's it. It overlooked an old dilapidated house in an alley full of stray cats ( we counted 12 at one time), and the train tracks. Now I realize that the hotel has nothing to do with that, but the balcony could have had some nice plants on it or flower pots. Minimal changes could have made this balcony a pleasure to use. All of the above were minor inconveniences that didn't detract from our trip, but I thought were worth mentioning. The breakfast was adequate on the rooftop terrace. The staff was pleasant. The train stops running at night ( train tracks in the back of hotel), so you are not disturbed during your sleep. Some great art pieces throughout. If you are looking for a modern or Marriott/Hilton, etc.. chain hotel experience, this hotel is not for you. We knew coming to this hotel what to expect after reading other trip advisor reviews, although I thought the rooms would be a bit bigger. The price and location is the reason I would recommend this hotel. If your booking qualifies you for a free airport pick up, great. If not I would recommend taking a taxi which was only 35 lira. Just make sure you have a map of the hotel, as there are so many little alleys that even the taxi drivers get lost once they get into Sultanahmet. It was really helpful that we had one. Overall a good experience at the Romantic Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanRSF
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff very friendly. We had the triple room for the two of us, which is large and has a Juliet balcony overlooking the street. The room was nice and the bed comfortable. It wasn't noisy but you could hear the call to prayer from the mosques nearby. Breakfast, which was a buffet, was great and the terrace with the sea view was lovely as we were there when the weather was magnificent. The location was perfect for touring the old city and there were many restaurants within two blocks.

Reviews.Title: “they welcomed us from the land downunder!”
Reviews.Author: RosealeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this quaint, exeptionally clean and comfortable hotel and greeted with a very warm welcome indeed! They even played our song "welcome to the land downunder" for us as we enjoyed a nice cold beer in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PETER H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the hotel room suite with balcony and grand view of the Sea of Marmara. Ideal for relaxing and having tea,coffee,or a drink after touring the historic sites and shopping in Istanbul during the day. The hotel,s complementary breakfast on the roof top was excellant pertaining to quality,varity, and service only surpasted by the view of the Sea of Marmara, Hagia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque from our breakfast table. The room was clean and comfortable,and the owners and staff were friendly and very helpful in assisting us with making transportation arrangments to other parts of Turkey that we wanted to visit. Peter and Cathy Hatzi

Reviews.Title: “Never seen so much care for decoration in the minutest detail”
Reviews.Author: MihaelasiIonut
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we don't regret it, as it certainly contributed its part to the charm of our experience in Istanbul which is one of the most fascinating cities we ever visited! We opted for the Dolmabahce Suite which is really giving one an Oriental taste of luxury, as attached photos should testify ( even the the trash bin is graciously wrapped in tulle). As the other reviews warned, the room gives over a railway and the immediate backyard view from the balcony is far from enchanting, but if one raises the eyes to the horizon it is is greatly compensated by the beautiful view of the Maramara Sea, with a glimpse of the Asian coast and, on clear days , of the nearest Prnices islands. The train did not disturb us at all as it stoped circulating at around midnight and probably in the morning when it started again, sleep was to deep to be disturbed ( we spent in total three nights there) . Location is also absolutely unbeatable for this hotel, it's really walking minutes away to Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque ,and most Sultanahmet attractions. As other reviews mentioned the staff is one of the friendliest and most eager to help we ever met in a hotel! However there are a few areas for improvement which if overcome would make this place absolutely perfect. - Cleanliness is acceptable, but not spotless! It was great to be able to get to our room immediately upon arrival ( before 12 am) however it was a less pleasant surprise to find in a drawer stuff left over by previous room occupants . Blinds were badly needing a clean and the white furniture a vigorous wiping. - The quality of the sleep would be excellent if it wasn't for the pillows that are stone rigid cylinders and the thick, rigid cloth with a very unpleasant touch that's provided as a cover sheet... - If it wasn't for the beautiful view and the pleasant atmosphere on the rooftop terrace, breakfast would be a big disapointment . Coffee is an awful pale couloured liquid, no fresh fruit except (literally) the same ( excessively) ripe watermelon and a poor variety of cereals and cheeses/ charcuterie . Despite this minor critics, we feel it was a good choice and do recommend this place to all who want to experience the taste of the old Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: jezabel2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in July. Great value, incredibly helpful staff, delicious breakfast and breathtaking Bosphorus and Blue Mosque view! Thank you Ahmad very much for your help in production our fotokast! You are a great manager and a wonderful man! Your smile, friendliness and cheerful way of being remembered today. I recommend to all without exception! Pics and sound on our web site www.jezabel.pl

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable with a delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: sbmc53
Reviews.Content: I had read about this hotel in Rick Steve's Istanbul book and our experience there exceeded even his high praises of the hotel and its staff. Two families, 7 people, traveled to Turkey in June and the Romantic Hotel was our first stop after flying in to Ataturk Airport in Istanbul. Our experience there set the bar high for the remainder of our trip. Erdal met us in the street as our van pulled up outside with an enthusiastic smile and humble spirit. He introduced us to Atilla, who also made sure our every wish, to their best ability, was satisfied. Erdal communicated with me via email for several months prior to our departure. He offered great suggestions as to what to do while we were in Istanbul and made reservations for us to have a Turkish speaking guide for a day. Breakfast was on the roof of the hotel overlooking the Bosphorus Sea. It was a traditional Turkish breakfast with tomatoes, cucumber, yogurt, figs, hard boiled eggs and cereal, Turkish tea and biscuits. Every restaurant that either Erdal or Atilla recommended was fabulous. Erdal even walked with us to one fish restaurant to make sure we got a good table. The rooms and bathrooms are small but the prices are great and, really, who stays in their room when visiting Istanbul? They were decorated very well with more of a feminine flair. We understood from Erdal that 2 women, one of whom is an artist, own the hotel. Her art is tastefully throughout the hotel. We stayed here our first 3 nights in Turkey and then one night at the end of our 2 week vacation. I heartily recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the old town Istanbul. We were just a block or so away from Blue Mosque, Haggai Sophia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. When we left, we felt as if we had been staying with a family member in another country.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel is Great!”
Reviews.Author: LikaKana82
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two week trip that included 4 nights in Istanbul at the Romantic Hotel. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely come again. Location was great--5 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and many restaurants are just around the corner as well. The rooms are small but well-kept. I didn't notice any fragrances in our room as the previous post mentions so that was not an issue for us. We had a room on the 1st floor with a balcony. I was glad we had only brought our carry-on sized suitcases as there was not much space for them but we managed fine. Breakfast was delicious and had many options--although the last morning we were there the food did not seem as fresh as the first few days (i.e, the cheese was sweaty)--I don't know if we were later for breakfast that day? It was not a big deal but worth mentioning. The staff was friendly and very hospitable. I exchanged a few emails with Erdal before our arrival and the responses were always prompt and helpful. As mentioned previously, he is fluent in English so there were no communication problems. The other staff members, Atila and Bedirhan (spelling?) were also helpful and friendly. We felt very at home here. We loved Istanbul and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel! The Desk/Sales Manager is so wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Andiamo_38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for several nights at the end of May - beginning June 2011. While out touring one day I accidentally erased our month long honeymoon vacation photos from my camera! I was beyond devastated. The Romantic Hotel Manager, Erdal Koptekin, realized my distress and immediately offered to help me. Not only that, but he was so compassionate and kind. He took the memory card, found a port & website and restored the photos to my camera. His determination to help me was amazing. I cannot THANK HIM ENOUGH ! I also noticed he came to breakfast and went to each table personally checking on the guests. In addition, the hotel is charming, very comfortable, conveniently located, spotlessly clean and the staff terrific. Our room was a perfect size for two with a very comfy bed and a balcony that gave us a view of the water. There is also a computer for hotel guests to use if you need one. We would go back here in a minute. Thank you Erdal ! You are the best. I will never forget your kindness.. You epitomize the friendliness of the Turkish people.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: StacyHawaii
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this hotel. You can't beat the location if you want to visit the usual tourist sites in the historic section of town and it is conveniently close to public transportation to see other parts of Istanbul. It's decorated very sweetly. Especially if you are partial to pink and flouncy! The staff was extremely helpful and had enough English for most questions. Most rooms and the breakfast room have great views. The breakfasts are EXCEPTIONAL and I've wanted to relive that part of my stay many times! Though I thought they could do without the very large and very loud television often playing disturbing world news in Turkish or modern Turkish music videos. I would of preferred music, either classical or traditional Turkish. I hope the staff reads this suggestion. The only downsides are the smallish rooms and the fragrance used. We had two smallish people, two med-large suitcases and two carry-ons. The room was hard to maneuver in for us. They do have a suite which is much larger and worth the splurge for more space. The fragrance is a personal preference. I don't like artificial scents myself. But it was easy to unhook the one in my room. Overall i highly recommend this place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ahah64
Reviews.Content: The service at this small boutique hotel cannot be beat from the ever helpful and always friendly Erdal at the front desk to the smiling and singing Hilmiye at your service in the rooftop restaurant with views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosporus Strait. This small hotel is located in the historic Sultanahmet neighborhood in the Old Town. All the sights of the Old Town are within easy walking distance (The Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar, the Topkapi Palace, the Archeological Museum). We even walked from the hotel to the Galata Tower in the New District across the Bosporus Strait. Yet, the neighborhood is a quiet, secluded spot away from the tourist areas. The rooms are small but adequate and they are clean. We found this jewel in our Rick Steves "Istanbul" guide book. The hotel is economical and a great find for our first visit to Turkey and Istanbul. You won't find a friendlier place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: gpacarl
Reviews.Content: At 74 years old on his first trip to Istanbul, I was looking for a great location, helpful staff, and a neat room. I found all of this at the Romantic Hotel. The two gentlemen who worked the front desk were just great in giving me pointers on where to go, how to get there and back, and general information. The hotel has a good breakfast on a rooftop cafÃ© with views of the Bosporus and Blue Mosque. Within walking distance were many of the sights I wanted to visit like the Blue Mosque, Avasofya Museum, Grand Bazaar and the tram was near by to get you into the other areas of Istanbul. There are many good restaurants in the area for your enjoyment. If I ever return to Istanbul I will be sure to stay here. Carl Quist, Port Angeles, WA USA

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Hanwari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Romantic Hotel in Istanbul for close to two weeks. It has an excellent location right in the heart of Sultan Ahmet Area. It is within walking distance of The Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Topkapi Sarayi as well as the Basilica Cistern. There is public transport at about 5 minutes walk. The rooms are a little small but the service is excellent specially because of Mr Erdal. He is fluent in English and our stay was made extremely comfortable in all respects. Whether we needed a taxi or directions or even calling up our customers so that they will pick us up from the desired points. He also knows the best eating places and the places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: leckysrl
Reviews.Content: Hi, We spent 4 nights (new year's eve days) at Romantic Hotel and we had wonderful time. Great Location: just 5mins walk from St. Sophia Mosque and Blue Mosque, 5 mins to the tram station. Kind and Professional Service at Desk thanks Erdal & Atilla: anything we'd like to ask and do in Instanbul they provided to us. Nice rooms, clean and nice view. We strongly recomend you this hotel. Alessandro & Chiara

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Marie_CZ
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality. The hotel`s staff was always genuinely helpful and attentive . We stayed in the Dolmabahce Suite which we warmly reccomend since the room is quite big and enjoys a spectacular view over the Marmara sea. The hotel is located in the Sultanahmet area and nearby some key attractions of Istanbul (i.e. Topkapi) all at walking distance. Veery good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My new best friend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: d_newlin
Reviews.Content: My new best friend in Istanbul is Erdal. We exchanged numerous emails with Erdal to line up our stay. He was ever so gracious, helpful and hospitable. The location was perfect: near the Blue Mosque and restaurants, shopping and people watching. Our room was on the third floor overlooking the street; we loved it. We highly recommend Romantic Hotel (it was!). Thank you Erdal. David and Lindie

Reviews.Title: “The Romantic is an excellent hotel if you plan to visit the Sultanahmet area.”
Reviews.Author: Guanica8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Romantic Hotel for four days and nights. The location is excellent if one wants to be within walking distance of the Sultanahmet area. The staff was very helpful. Erdal and Attila went out of their way to assist us with taxis and sightseeing information. The breakfast was outstanding. The rooms are small, which might be a concern for some, but we had a terrace with excellent views. The cost was very reasonable for the value we received. Safety was not an issue with the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Location and views make this hotel a winner!”
Reviews.Author: jhneyer
Reviews.Content: Read about Romantic hotel in Rick Steve's and then checked it out on Tripadvisor. Romantic hotel is clean, the location is fantastic, the staff super friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small, but comfortable and typical by European standards. But the best is the views fron the roof top terrace restaurant/bar. we had an enjoyable breakfast here each morning and spent several evenings viewing he Blue Mosque illuminated-a beautiful sight to enjoy with a glass of wine and good company- Romantis!! Thanks Erdal and Atilla!. Almost forgot the bathroom is remodeled with a comfortable shower!

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: kaymordi
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful hotel that I ever stay, nice, clean, peaceful and lovely. You can see a very nice view for the blue mosque from the top at the resturant and also you can see the sea side also. Come and stay here then you will really reach the Istanbu :)

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Etienne34
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. Quiet, cosy, peacefull and clean. I wish you (travellor) come and stay here for a night or lifelong ! Great !

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Comfortable, and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: annaventurer
Reviews.Content: The charming Romantic Hotel is located within walking distance of the major historical sites. The hotel staff was so friendly & accommodating, I felt no request was too large or small for them to handle! Each morning was a true pleasure with breakfast from the hotel terrace overlooking the gorgeous Marmara Sea. The great suggestions from the knowledgeable staff (thank you, Ilkay!) contributed to an enjoyable first-time visit to Istanbul. I will certainly return for another visit to Istanbul and to the wonderful Romantic Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Friendliest Service.”
Reviews.Author: CottonHair
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 girlfriends and stayed in the 'family room'. Small room for 4 women and 6 suitcases - but it's not about the room.... It's about the location, it's about the breakfast on the terrace with the most beautiful view, and it's about Ilkay, the most lovely man who made our trip super special. He took such good care of us and went above and beyond in every way. We felt as if we were staying at a friends home by the time we left.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and calm hotel in the middle of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: elbhang
Reviews.Content: I loved staying there with a friend for a long weekend. The hotel manager Erdal was the best you could wish for, very helpful and trying to make our stay as easy as possible. We especially enjoyed the 3 minute walking distance to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque while the street itself was totally calm and quiet at night. Clean and comfortable rooms for a good price. Great breakfast terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Like in a dream”
Reviews.Author: kenyaisa
Reviews.Content: Romantic hotel is a wonderful place, near the blue mosque, Santa sofia and topkapi palace. Very pretty hotel, clean and confortable. Thanks to Erdal and Fettah, from the hotel, I was like in a dream with the best guides of istanbul ! I recommend this hotel where I will come back soon it is sure !!! Isabelle

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: _-Aroundtheworld_039
Reviews.Content: The place was to a few meters from the Blue Mosque, and the breakfast was served on a terrace from which you could see even Saint Sofia and the sea; I would absolutely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience with insiders knowledge of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lovingretirement_10
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to spend five nights at the Romantic Hotel in Istanbul. Our hosts Fettah and Erdal were not only charming but very knowledgeable giving us insights into Istanbul that were not in any guide book. The hotel is critically located in the heart of old town with all its charm and history. Our room had a fantastic view of the Bosphorus and a deck that allowed us to sit outside and watch the ships sail by. The dining room located on the roof was ideal to start the morning with a traditional Turkish breakfast. The hotel staff supplied a driver to pick us up and drop us off at the airport. Fettah was kind enough to take us on a wonderful day trip to two small fishing villages on the Black Sea and several wonderful sites in Istanbul that we never would have found on our own. We enjoyed the day and an insiders view of Istanbul. We would highly recommend the Romantic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: MoAchPaPhi
Reviews.Content: Small cosy hotel with perfect location near blue mosque and hagia sophia. Erdal and Fettah take care about everything. We felt a bit like in a family (I stayed there with my son). From the roof terace - where the breakfast is served - you have an awesome view to blue mosque and hagia sophia on one side and the marmara sea on the other side! We hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “So Much Fun!”
Reviews.Author: ruthielovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We scheduled a long week in Istanbul to visit our daughter who was studying there for a semester. We brought two teenagers with us and we booked a suite which had a tiny but adequate room for the parents and a comfortable room for our kids at a very reasonable price. The location was dazzling. The delicious Turkish breakfast on the rooftop terrace took our breath away with views of the Bosporus and the Blue Mosque--we hardly knew which way to look. Our younger daughter celebrated a birthday there and the incredibly gracious staff arranged a special birthday dinner in her honor. There was dancing and birthday cake and delightful company. We were treated like respected friends. I highly recommend The Romantic Hotel. It was modest and delightful--it's strengths are an attentive staff, a glorious location, delicious breakfasts, thoughtful recommendations.It was excellent value. The bedrooms lacked sufficient storage and the shower, while functional, was quite a tight fit.However, if you are weighing comfort and affordability for a large family , The Romantic Hotel suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Was good for us - pick your room”
Reviews.Author: ColinP3
Reviews.Content: A small historical hotel close to the Blue Mosque and the other tourist sights. Easy walking distance to restaurants and all of the main tourist areas, and to the tram that you can take to the ferries or other places. We really liked it - we booked a "suite" that had two rooms, for 4 with two teenagers, and it worked out well - very comfortable, and quite quiet as the street is not too busy (apart from the prayer calls that woke us up each morning). The rooms were rather small, so it was hard to have 4 people walking around at the same time, but not bad compared to many places we have stayed for the price. The food was great in the breakfast area on the roof - which had a fantastic view over the Sea of Marama, and it was great to sit there in the mornings in the sun. The people who manned the desk were super helpful and friendly, and really made us feel very welcome. A few issues - the wireless internet worked fine with a router on each floor, but was quite variable in the speed of the data (just a slow connection at times?). The bathrooms were OK but the shower was a little crammed and the corners of the shower were not too clean. An issue to watch out for is that the rooms on the other side of the hotel overlook the railroad track, and may be a lot noisier - that was not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “really Istanbul romantic for good value”
Reviews.Author: IngaLatvia
Reviews.Content: It was leisure + a little bit business trip to Istanbul. I am coming to Istanbul much but this time I wanted get nice historical hotel for my mother birthday celebrating. Lucjely I am founded Romantic Hotel through AirBaltic offer package. But I am booked hotel strightly using hotel e mail. In December, I examine the hotel room because I wanted to ascertain whether they are sufficiently large. I read the comments on the internet that they are very small. But pleased to see me. Of course, that an old building may not want a huge room. In Historic buildings there are not also a lift. but the building is only 3 storeys. Lift only damaged the historic building's image. We stayed in one triple room and one double. Double room has a lovely balcony where the evening can look to the Marmara Sea. If the normal baggage instead of 10 suitcases, the room is big enough. Waltz, there will not be able to dance but to feel the fantastic atmosphere of both the Ottoman period will be. Rooms are clean, the bathroom is a shower gel, soap (it is unfortunately not a few other small hotels). Breakfast is served in a wonderful terrace overlooking the Marmara Sea. Breakfast is a great choice for a small botique hotel. We dont look in Turkey ham bacon, fried eggs, etc.. It is the choice of cheese, eggs, very tasty white yogurt, fruits, vegetables, olives, various jams, nuts, coffee, tea and the wonderful Turkish bread. Very nice furnished terrace with a cool time is heated. Terrace available for guests around the clock. In the evening there opens a wonderful view of the Marmara Sea. Staff is just amazingly generous. My mum's birthday surprise waiting-colored balloons with the greeting: Happy Birthday! It was fantastic the staff treated their guests! Unexpected and pleasant surprise. Caring for the guests felt the whole time. Of all the hotels I stay the best in memory. I wold be come back again. In here is everything a tourist may wish to live in an old-building, clean, excellent location, since all the important facilities are readily achievable, as well as the friendly and responsive staff.

Reviews.Title: “not only romantic”
Reviews.Author: Susak28
Reviews.Content: you'll find everything you need to make you feel good.....the location is perfect....you can just walk to the main 'touristic attractions' and at the same time it takes you 5 minutes to reach areas 'off the beaten track' and the promenade along the sea. Very comfortable beds youâ€™ll be happy to jump into after a day of walking - good breakfast served by friendly Susak on a terrace with an amazing view of the sea and the islands [+Blue Mosque on the other side]. Last but not least, youâ€™ll be meeting a wonderful staff there.....youâ€™ll find Ilkay playing violin in the lobby if youâ€™re lucky - Erdal will have an answer to all your questions and a solution to all your requests and Fettah will also make your stay at the Romantic hotel unforgettable with his contagious joie de vivreâ€¦.bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “The staff made us feel like family!”
Reviews.Author: MitchBeijing
Reviews.Content: A truly charming hotel, with an absolutely AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING (and incredibly helpful) staff. Perfect location within Sultanahmetâ€”a less than 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern, Arasta Bazaar, and the tram. Fantastic views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a lovely weekend”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreM91
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, (blue mosque, saint sophia, palace, and tram by 2min' walk) Kind staff, Romantic and cozy rooms, Awesome breakfast on the roof, we realy enjoyed it !

Reviews.Title: “great location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolDiane
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff could not do enough to help and advise us. We had a beautiful, clean comfortable room with a little balcony overlooking the Bosphorous. Each morning we had a Turkish breakfast on the roof terrace with views of the Blue Mosque. I hope to return to Istanbul one day and would have no hesitation in staying at the Romantic again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rujenov
Reviews.Content: You can comfortably choose Romantic Hotel in Istanbul. It's located at the heart of the historical heritages of the city. Has a great stuff, see Ilkay especially. Absolutely, consider their advices.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IdrisGani
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 2 stop holiday, and our first leg was 4 nights in the magical city of Istanbul a place full of such nice people. And our hotel stay was really nice, with the staff being especially helpful. We made our choice from reading a review on tripadvisor, and for a family with 3 small children like us its just the place to stay. It is Located in the central area of SultanAhmet. The hotel is Just 5 minutes away from the Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Topkai Palace (a must see museum) but in a very peaceful and quite street. It is the place we will goto over and over again and if Mr Erdal and the team are still there it will make it even more better. Our children absolutely loved it at this hotel, and the view from the roof terrace is so Romantic!!! Idris G. and Family PS. ask the staff any Question about the city and they will guide you so well.

Reviews.Title: “An oriental hotel with a charming staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsDarcy_E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the ancient part of the city, very close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, a small bazar street and many other sights. One has the possibility to stroll through small streets and to enjoy very good restaurants, oriental shops and to get to know the friendliness of Istanbul's inhabitants. The hotel staff is very friendly and keen to make a go of every accomodation. The breakfast room is located at the top of the hotel and has on the one side a great view on the Marmara sea and on the other side to the Blue Mosque; the breakfast itself is very diversified. The suite of the hotel is nicely decorated, very clean and has a breathtaking view to the Asian part of the city and the Marmara Sea. So make sure to reserve the suite. With a small balcony, it is certainly worth the extra cash.

Reviews.Title: “truely a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kustah_kiz
Reviews.Content: Well decorated cosy hotel perfectly situated near to many restaurants, shops and sights! Rooms are delightful as are the staff, Hamza and Ilkay were extremely friendly and helpful! Absolutely stunning view to be seen from the breakfast area on the roof top!

Reviews.Title: “watch out the rate they charge you !”
Reviews.Author: JMen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice location, and if it wasn't by the payment problem I've had, I would give it an OK, even though it is a bit overrated and from my point of view too expensive. When I booked the hotel in expedia I was given a price per night in euros (200 euros per night). When I checked out I realized they were charging my credit card in turkish lira at a conversion rate slightly on their advantage. I told them immediately and they replied with a smile: "no problem, if you are charged more, just call us and then we'll solve the problem". My credit card was charged with 26 euros more than expected. I called them and they asked me to write an email. Then after two months without a reply to my email, I wrote them again and their answer was: "we don't reimburse the cost, you should contact your bank"! I find that outrageous ! They chose an exchange rate given by their bank or whatever, but that is THEIR problem. If they gave me a price of 200 euros per night, they should respect that quote and bring the exchange rate down or just pay me the difference afterwards. I advise you not to sign the invoice until they bring the exchange rate down to the price you expect to pay. It is a shame that on a 800 euro bill, not wanting to pay me back some silly 26 euros, means they have a bad review and a customer that will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “you can not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cakz
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Romantic hotel with our two young children. The room was fantastic- top floor with comfortable bed and double-glazing on the windows- heaven! Breakfast is on the rooftop with the best views- clear views over the harbour in one direction and the Blue Mosque in the other. Location is wonderful, quiet- but just around the corner from loads of restaurants and 2min walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya and the Topkapi Palace (well worth going inside). The most fantastic thing about this little hotel however, is the service you receive from all the staff, but particularly the manager Erdal. We arrived exhausted and had problems with our car hire company- Erdal searched the internet for the number (the one we had been given was wrong), spoke to them in Turkish for me as they didn't understand English and then arranged for them to collect the car from the hotel so we didn't have to worry about leaving again. He gave us great tips on the best Bospherous cruise company to go for and was always free to give a few minutes attention for the kids- my son in particular was very sad to leave him and asked if he could come to Australia to visit! Thanks for such a wonderful tie- we shall be back again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MillarOslo
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 lovely days at Romantic Hotel celebrating my husbands 60th bithday, and we could not have got a warmer welcome! Both the weather and the staff - especially Hamza and Ilkoy - were brilliant! The views from the breakfast room / sun terrace are stunning, with the Blue Mosque only a stone throw away. This little hotel lies in a very clean and safe area, and the location is great for all expeditions. Nearby you will find lots of nice restaurants, shops and relaxing cafÃ©es. Remember to bring good walking shoes! And do not get upset with the shopkeepers who try to sell you jewellery or carpets, just smile and talk to them and you will find the to be very frienldy. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel recommendation through a friend of us and we did not regret our decision at all. The hotel taxi service from the airport made the start of our weekend city trip very smooth. Having a drink in the evening at the hotel roof terrace is a must, even though you will enjoy your breakfast there as well. Some of the rooms are not too big, so if you have huge suitcase it can get tricky, but for weekend trip totally fine. Neighborhood is peaceful and we did most of sightseeing straight away from hotel as majority of highlights is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and moderately good value”
Reviews.Author: tjcantor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just east of the Blue Mosque in the Sultanahmet area and is only 5-10 mins walk from many of the main attractions. We stayed in room 202, a standard room, and enjoyed a view of the Golden Horn. The room, however, was very cramped, the door to the veranda was broken and required repairing during our stay. We stayed three nights and on the second day, the maid, having done a decent job of cleaning the room, had for some reason thrown our bed cover on top of the wardrobe. It got fairly chilly at night so it was puzzling why the hotel thought we wouldn't need the covers and why on top of the wardrobe? There is a TV and fridge with softdrinks. As far as we could tell there was no English news available and there was no complimentary water. There is a train nearby that goes by now and again but it didnt bother us at all. The interior design of the hotel is quaint as is shown on the website. Breakfast consisted of fruits, cereal, boiled eggs, bread, jams, coffee, tea, orange juice, hams, tomatoes, lettuce, cheese and was satisfying. The woman in the breakfast area could have been a little more friendly. There is a nice view of the Blue Mosque from the roof. Free wireless internet is available throughout the hotel but didn't always work properly. The reception staff were quite friendly and helpful; they looked after our luggage for a few days while we traveled around Turkey before we had actually stayed with them and they arranged a shuttle bus back to Sabiha Goekon airport (20 Lira per person), a more reasonable alternative to a taxi (50 Euro). They also kindly had some laundry done for us (1kg 15-20 Lira) which I thought was a little expensive. Our stay was 80 Euro a night when paid by cash.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff compliment a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mick_CBS
Reviews.Content: My partner Julie-ann and I stayed at the Romantic Hotel for two nights after a cruise from Athens. The location of the hotel so close to all the old city attractions and the great water views from the room and rooftop are well documented but again I must make special mention of the friendliness and helpfulness of all of the staff (Ahmed,Tunji, and Emrah). They certainly go well beyond their call of duty to assist in every way possible including organising bookings at some great restaurants. Thanks guys -- we look forward to meeting you again sometime. And just an extra tip if you stay there -- having pre dinner drinks on the rooftop taking in the views makes for a very special start to the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sobee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here from Sep 3rd 2009 for four days. We booked this hotel from the hotel's website. Booking was easy and email communication was very prompt. We booked the Dolmabahce Suite eight months in advance. We were not disappointed. We had a great view of Marmara Sea. The hotel is situated within easy walking distance (five minutes max) of the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. Our room was very spacious, however we saw that indeed some of the other rooms were quite small. The very nice breakfast was served on the top floor where we had great views of the Blue Mosque and the old houses of Sultanahmet. Emrah, Erdahl and Tuncay were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: aussiesabout
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quaint and beautifully appointed. It is small enough to feel as if it is a home away from home with staff remembering you and making you feel content and happy to return each day. Location ideal for wandering around cobblestone streets and close to mosques, markets, and shops. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the sea was a magic way to start each day. Staff ably assisted with tourist arrangments and recommended various activities with lots of directions for a couple of Aussies who continually got lost in the maze of little streets around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, old world style , and quaint. Location cannot be beat. Situated in a very nice old , quieter, section of old Istanbul with cobblestone streets , and about a 5 minute walk to the heart of the old town, trolley, etc. many restaurants, mini mart, etc only a few steps away. The hotel is tall and skinny (like Amsterdam buildings) with only two rooms on each floor and the breakfast restaurant on the roof (nice views of the river ). Rooms tend to be rather small, although we got a free upgrade to the suite, but my kids got a smaller double room. Very old world hotel, both in size and decoration (very Victorian). We tend to like hotels like this vs the bigger, less personal, but more luxurious, hotels. Staff was excellent. Hotel photos shown are fairly accurate. I highly recommend it for those looking for a great location, reasonable price, friendly staff, and more than adequate rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Kind and unobtrusive staff, small rooms but great service”
Reviews.Author: Mamma_Aiuto
Reviews.Content: After a day in Istanbul with all its shopkeepers trying anything to have you buy their stuff, the Romantic Hotel was a quiet and relaxing place to be. It's quite clean, the presentation is a little bit rococo but not displeasing, and the staff is very nice and carefull, and always amiable. The only downside (or kind of) was when we took the hotel's own shuttle service from Sabiha Airport. It's very expensive (60 euros) and the driver drove like crazy, typing messages on his cell-phone while doing 160 kph in the traffic, and shouting at the other cars that didn't open him the way. Some people may enjoy it though. We didn't. On the way back, we took a normal shuttle service (appointed for us by the hotel staff), we paid 4 euro per person, the minibus of course stopped at few other hotels to take passengers, but the ride was much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Romantic Hotel made our trip to Istanbul extra special”
Reviews.Author: Th0mS
Reviews.Content: My husband & I & 3 other friends all stayed at The Romantic Hotel for a week in July. After long flights from Australia we were all delighted with the hotel which is very cute, but also the fantastic location. We had the attic room & our friends had the family room. Our friends arrived a day ahead of us, but we all received a transfer from the airport (return also) as part of the deal which was great. From the moment we arrived the Manager, Erdal, & the other members of staff were all extremely helpful & nothing was too much trouble. The Hotel is in a fantastic location, only 5-10min walk to the Mosques & Topkapi Palace & about a 15min walk to the Grand Bazaar. There is a huge selection of restaurants only one street away which is another bonus. If you want to experience the Sultanahmet area we could not think of a better place to stay. The hotel terrace was great, both in the evening for a pre dinner drink with views of both of the Mosques all lit up & also in the morning for the terrific breakfast, with views out over the Marmara Sea & the Asian side of Istanbul. The rooms are not the biggest we have ever stayed in, but they were very comfortable & clean & the air conditioning was great which was important! If you don't like stairs then this hotel may not be for you - but if you like the idea of keeping fit while you are trying all the Turkish fare then you won't mind in the least! Value for money was exceptional - if you decide to give it a try we hope you like it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel with great service and kindly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Teglola
Reviews.Content: Great stay in Istanbul in three days for both us as a couple and for our teenagers. Situated very central and just a few meters from both the Blue mosque and Hagia Sofia. The best recommandations

Reviews.Title: “perfect and pleasing service. wonderful stay for honymoon”
Reviews.Author: ParisSuz
Reviews.Content: My husbund and I, have choosen this nice Romantic Hotel to spend our honymoon. It was wonderful and suitable place for such a stay. very calm, clean and good service.The staff is very nice with a smiling reception make you feel very welcome. I thank them for unswering all our questions and guide us to the easier way to visit Istanbul without paying too much. Thank youuuuuuuuuuu!!!!! we do loved the breakfast. it was very complete and with a very wonderful view on the sea and the bleu mosque. oh It was wonderful!!! i'm so happy of choosing Romantic Hotel for this unforgettable travel. and I do advice you really to go there. you will have no regret. Ihsan & Suzanne

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: veedo
Reviews.Content: what an amzing experience!! istanbul is a great city, but the romantic hotel and staff multiplied that experience tenfold!!! especially ahmed the manager of the place. we saved so much time and money due to thier advice. the proximity to all the cultural sights is ideal, I cant wait to go back and will definately be staying there again. a complete pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You For The Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaVaLeiden
Reviews.Content: Perfect, charming, small hotel. Clean and breakfast good, with great views over the city. ERDAL and EMRAH tesekur ederiz, thank you very mutch for your service, help and information. You made our stay for us, and our friends, perfect. Selam, vahit abi ve Marieke

Reviews.Title: “Stunning little gem, hidden away but amazing location and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fishbananas
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on this website and took a risk but all the reviews were correct - a fantastic place to stay. We stayed had the family rooms (2 adults & 2 children) and having been picked up from the airport were amazed how friendly everyone was. The rooms were compact but more than adequate to cope with four of us and a weeks luggage. The breakfast was superb with views of the Bosphorous AND the Hagia Sophia AND the Blue Mosque. For such a small hotel their positioning in terms of attractions and restaurants was stunning. (But beware of the man touting for business outside a nearby hotel - the kids nicknamed him Mr Grumpy). The only issue would be their lack of restaurant but there are so many nearby that choice was never a problem even for the picky vegetarians amongst us. Excellent hotel, would recommend it very highly and would go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ridsel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a month traveling in Italy, Greece, and Turkey. We stayed at many comparable hotels in that time (i.e. similar rate/night, number of stars, etc) and found Romantic Hotel Istanbul to be our favorite of all of them. The location is highly convenient to the main attractions and public transport and the breakfast terrace has amazing views. The rooms are not large but are clean and tidy. The thing that made Romantic Hotel Istanbul stand out was the level of service. In particular, Erdel (the manager) was very friendly and knowledgeable. He arranged airport pickups and drop offs (good value), told us how to get places, what to seek out, and what to avoid. He even helped us find someone to do our laundry at a reasonable price i.e. hotel-level service for do-it-yourself pricing. His staff were also friendly and helpful and there was always someone around to help out. We would stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay in Istanbul, stay here”
Reviews.Author: DalaiLama62
Reviews.Content: Romantic Hotel is a small hotel in the historical centre of Istanbul, close to the major sights of Sultanahmet (5min to Blue Mosque and St. Sophia, 10min to Topkapi Palace). A lot of restaurants are also within an easy walking distance. The hotel is clean and quiet. We stayed for 4 days and had the family room. The family room is divided into 2 rooms by a wall with door - a double-bed area and an area with 2 single beds. The view from the roof terrace was unforgettable. You can see the Blue Mosque and the Marmara Sea. Staff was very friendly - especially Erdal. He has an answer to every question. We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for a romantic honeymoon or anniversary”
Reviews.Author: honeemoonr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I waited 6 months after our wedding to go on our honeymoon to time it with the best weather for getting married in California and honeymooning in Europe. We had stayed at 8 other hotels during our one month honeymoon trip and by far Romantic Hotel Istanbul was the best of them all mainly because of the excellent service of the hotel manager, Erdal. He was so friendly and knowledgeable about how to get around in Istanbul. We especially liked that he warned us about which restaurants not to go to because he didn't want us to be swindled during our stay in Istanbul. He even helped us find someone to do our laundry at a reasonable price! Most of all, we liked the fact that we were picked up and taken to the airport so it was the least stressful arrival or departure we had during the monthlong trip. If we ever went back to Istanbul for an anniversary, we would go back and stay at Romantic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This fantasy hotel tickled my fancy every second I stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: turkeychick
Reviews.Content: The Romantic Hotel caught my fancy online and lived up to my expectations in reality. From the moment I arrived until I departed I could not stop smiling. The exterior and interior decoration of this tiny jewel is fussily frilly and frivolous - cute, cozy and friendly. As a single woman I enjoyed the individualised attention by staff who made me feel part of the family. Sparkling morning views, from the breakfast terrace, of the Blue Mosque on one side and the Sea of Marmara on the other side were magical. Really the whole experience of staying in Sultanahmet, at the Romantic Hotel, was like an adult Disney experience. If you are going to Istanbul you should should include a stay at this hotel as part of a very special experience. (However, if you need a lift/elevator this is not the place for you.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice view and good services”
Reviews.Author: jjuna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located istanblu and near The Bluemosk. I walked to the Bluemosk 5 minutes on foot. It is good place to closed to the history interests. I stayed suite room, it was clean , quite and good view. At restaurant, top of the building, I saw the Bluemosk while eating breakfast. Staffs war so kind. I was satisfied with this hotel~

Reviews.Title: “I miss Romantic Hotel, I miss Istambul”
Reviews.Author: KAKAOWIEC
Reviews.Content: First of all, really kind, helpful hotel staff, always putting you in a cheerful mood! Secondly, amazing view from the terrace - to the Blue Mosque and on the other side - to the sea. Good breakfasts consisted of everything you may need. Original interior of the rooms - really comfortable beds, clean bathroom. Great location - 200 m from Blue Mosque, so you may have great oportunity to hear a muezin's voice! I wish I were in Romantic Hotel now, writing these words! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel - good choice and unforgettable muezzin voice”
Reviews.Author: Diorek
Reviews.Content: First of all very good location, close to the most popular monument, (e.g.Blue Mosque adn Hagia Sophia in Old Town. Very comfortable beds and modern bathroom, cosy rooms and really romatic ;-) I recommend you to book a doble room on the 3 floor with the seaside view ;-) Secondly very nice hotel staff , especially Erdal ;-) who take care of us during our stay. They also organized our pick up from the airport ;-) And the most important thing: breakfast with amazing view from roof terrace ;-)) We spent there 5 night - and it was really good choi Oktay's friends from Warsaw

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location. Book the suite at the top of the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: CherylBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Romantic Hotel and after an initial problem with our airport pick up ( which they were very apologetic for), we had a wonderful stay. We were upgraded to the executive suite which one sees in the photos and were very happy about that as the other rooms are very small. The staff are friendly and helpful and its an easy walk to see the best sights of Istanbul. Thanks to the management for being so helpful and sorting out the problems so speedily.

Reviews.Title: “Such a lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: Roxelan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dolmabahce suit for four nights last week, and if you like that, it is exactly like in the pictures on the Romantic website, and you almost feel like the Sultan himself. The view from the room is amazing, and waking up to that view is a privilege worth the price. We had the chance of seeing another room, a standard double, and it was a bit on the small side but perfectly clean and well taken care of. That's something you notice at the hotel - everything is carefully arranged and the place is very comfortable and kind of homey. And then you have the people working there, who are so extremely nice and polite and will go out of their way to make your life easier, without never being overbearing. I'd definitely recommend the Romantic Hotel because of the location, the facilities, ambience, and kindness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “cosy accommodation, very helpful stuff!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineBonn
Reviews.Content: We felt very comfortable during our entire stay. The room was cosy and the stuff was kind and helpful, especially Mister Adil Ossbebem (not sure about the spelling, sorry for that). He gave us friendly advice and was always trying to make our stay as pleasant as possible; looking where to find football fanshops for instance :-) Thank you so much!! The only thing we were sorry about was that the roof-terrace was being fixed and could'nt be used. But thanks to the nice wether we were outside most of the time anyway. Greetings from Germany, Daniela + Caroline

Reviews.Title: “Coziness in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: G3225
Reviews.Content: Located just 3 minutes away from Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, 6 minutes off the Cisterns and not more than 10 minutes -all walking distances- from TopKapi Palace, Romantic hotel offers a privileged location for those wanting to enjoy Istanbul's main attractions. With its terrace fully refurbished, the day couldn't start better than by having breakfast while enjoying an impressive view of the Blue Mosque on one side, and the neighborhood's landscape opening to the Marmara sea on the other. The rooms may not be huge but are nicely decorated (if you prefer a bigger room ask for one of their suites), but the staff is kind and helpful and will make you feel at home, still living you space as to feel you are not loosing your privacy as it sometimes happens in other small B&B. Despite the size, even the small rooms are fully equipped (hair-dryer, TV, air-conditioning, minibar) and the nice balcony contributes to the cozy atmosphere. The neighborhood is quiet and allows lovely night strolls. The train and tramway are just a few minutes away -walking distance-, allowing you to move swiftly to other areas of Istanbul. Taxis are also available, and the hotel staff are always ready to help you in planning your tours, getting you transportation, reccommending restaurants etc... We enjoyed our stay deeply and just wished we had had more leisure time.

Reviews.Title: “best loation, friendly staff, fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: CristianRoma
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of historical Istanbul, few steps from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, sorrounded by many typical restaurants the Romantic Hotel and its friendly staff is the best in Istanbul. The, unique of its style, fully equipped rooms wiil afford you to live the ancient atmosphere of the the earliest times. the terrace where the breakfast is served offers a beatuliful view of the Marmara sea. I suggest all travellers to stay at Romantic Hotel Istanbul, I also want to thank the staff for the warm welcome received.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Discovering Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: IrishDubcouple
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotel is excellent for discovering Istanbul, The Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia just steps away, Also plenty of restaurants & a few bars very close by. The Staff were very friendly and very helpful. (The helped us in everything we asked with no qualms or hesitation) The room was in perfect condition and the decor of the room & throughout the hotel was in a beautiful venetian style. The hotel arranged airport pickup which was great as our flight was late in. Our Room was also upgraded when we arrived which again was brilliant from a double to a family & the bed was very comfortable. There is also a Terrance restaurant / bar on the Top of the hotel with wonderful views of the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque & the Sea of Marmara. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, and it is ideal for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice atmosphere, such a lovely hotel..”
Reviews.Author: alina60
Reviews.Content: It was my husbandâ€™s birthday when we were in this beautiful hotel. (stayed for a week in the 2. Half of march) Although it wasnâ€™t our first time in Istanbul (this was the 4.time), we enjoyed it very much. The friendly staff, good location, comfortable rooms, delicious breakfast at the wonderful terrace. We were impressed by the view of the Marmara Sea and the Islands and the marvellous Blue Mosque.. We will be pleased to see you friends on the 5th time and for sure it wonâ€™t be too far from now Lots of Love from Italy Alina

Reviews.Title: “Romantic,Friendly,Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: dimi_Igoumenitsa
Reviews.Content: I'm from Greece and believe me i know about Hotels....Romantic hotel is small but good organize hotel very clean with hi training personnel to satisfaction all your stay needs. One think is for sure.......I'm going again to Istanbul and believe it or not im gona stay in Romantic Hotel, its not the price or the place.......But the people!!! Special thanks to: Atilla Ozer.

Reviews.Title: “Great small B&B for a short city break, extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tomfoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days and had a great experience. Located right below the blue mosque on a quiet street, this B&B had only 8 rooms and thus with a 24 hour a day concierge, gave great service; above and beyond with certain requests. Some rooms are better than others and I would advise you to ask for a room on the 1st or 2nd floor (not basement or ground). Breakfasts were adequate but nothing fancy. Small balcony was nice touch for room and everything was very clean and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly people in a very nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: WINTERTHURLEPE
Reviews.Content: Always frinedly, always helpful, always there - we felt almost as being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: AlanUsa
Reviews.Content: Decoration, cleaning and location are the most important advantages for you. Thank you for the staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, hepful staff”
Reviews.Author: anthro101
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Hotel Romantic were helpful to us at every stage of our stay, 27/02/09-03/03/09 here while we visited the sites around Turkey. The hotel is a renovated home and the rooms are not huge, but the location and friendliness of the staff, as well as a the affordability, make up for the smaller sized rooms.The first room we stayed in was a a bit small, but the next night the staff re-located us to a large room, a triple, at no extra cost on the 3rd floor that overlooked the road. The bathroom and shower was quite large and comfortable. We could easily have stayed longer, had we not traveled to Seljuk to see the Greek and Roman ruins there. The hotel provides a large breakfast buffet each morning. The hotel is located two blocks or less from the Blue Mosque and all the other great sites around this part of Istanbul. There are many. many good restaurants, pricey and inexpensive, within a block or two of the hotel. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay here and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with excellent people”
Reviews.Author: Hatama
Reviews.Content: I was 2 weeks ago with my girlfriend in Istanbul and stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Romantic. We were delighted by the very good location of the hotel ( just 5 minutes walking to the main attraction points), the rooms and the personnel which was always very helpful. Adding to this point we were very lucky because on the Valentine's Day we received a free upgrade from our normal room to the Dolmabahce Suite. I don't need to tell you that the room is like a pasha's place and the view is breathtaking. On the other side, the only part that wasn't according to our wishes was the breakfast. One had just few options when choosing what to eat. All in all i recommend you the hotel at any time and be sure that the staff will be there to make your stay 10 time better!

Reviews.Title: “Lost Our Friendship”
Reviews.Author: Bebles
Reviews.Content: We booked from England for seven nights on a package including flights. Our daughter who is based in Egypt then said that she would join us in Istanbul. Yilmaz wanted 130 Euro per night for a room for her to stay with us. We refused and found another hotel for her about 100 metres away at 50 Euros per night. The car we had ordered to collect us from the airport arrived an hour after we cleared passport and Customs control. Yilmaz still wanted to charge us 30 Euros for the transfer when the going rate was 30/35 Lira, which is what we paid a taxi for all 3 of us on the way back! [The hotel my daughter stayed at gave her a free transfer as she was staying 7 nights]. I had read reviews that warned about the rooms next to the reception area being noisy and so had asked for a room on another floor. We were given room 202 at the back of the hotel. It was tiny. It may have been ok for one night for one person but totally inappropriate for a couple staying for a week. The room overlooked the Marmara sea but the foreground was a mix of broken roofs and run down buildings. Perhaps the most annoying feature was the railway line running past just 50 metres way. The sound of trains building up speed or slowing down as they approached the station was unacceptable. Nowhere to hang clothes or store in drawers in the bedroom and no place to put toiletries in the bathroom made it uncomfortable; particularly when the very small shower cubicle leaked all over the floor. We naturally complained and Yilmaz accepted that there were problems and moved us to room 303 on the third floor; a triple room at the front of the hotel. The added space made for a more comfortable stay but the lack of heating meant that it was far from cosy. We did manage to get the heating turned up one night but it was down again the following day. The hotel is clean; it is in a good location and the staff; Ahmed the night steward, and the lady who prepared breakfast and cleaned the rooms were as helpful as you could possibly hope to find. Not too sure why anyone rated this hotel so highly in the reviews we read before we booked the place. We went with an open mind but felt really quite let down by Yilmaz who had a number of rooms vacant throughout the week and could easily have accommodated our daughter and made a few extra Turkish Lira as a consequence; his loss. Hopefully he will improve the facilities in the future so that new guests see an improved value for money service. This is classed as a "Boutique/ 4* hotel" but it barely scrapes above a hostel level. Calling itself a refurbished "Ottoman Mansion" is a meaningless term and doesn't translate into any quality measure. On a scale of 0 to 5 this hotel must rate at about 2 and that is only because of the friendly staff, the overall cleanliness and the proximity to the major sites of Istanbul ."

Reviews.Title: “small pearl in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: maxluis
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect to visit the most monumental side of ancient Istanbul, including Hagya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi. Moreover, very closed to the most typical quarter in the area, Small Hagya Sofia. Good reception by the hotel, friendly and kind staff, in a romantic old stye environement. Clean and tidy, though the room was quite small. It's a pity for the weather that did not allow us to enjoy the beautiful terrace; however, the view from the room's small balcony was nice!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: balena75
Reviews.Content: the hotel is realli amazing!! The building is really cute and nice looking from outside and inside is very charming and comfortable. It is an old ottoman house and you cn tell this by staying there...really authentic feeling. It is located in the more faschinating area of the town where you see all old ottoman houses well restored and colored...it is really nice to walk around in the small streets around. Anyway, the best part of the experience is to meet the people working there! Ahmed and Ylmaz and even the lady who gave us breakfast are all wonderful. They helped us in anyway they could and when you talk with them the feeling is that you knew them already since long time... Istanbul is really a nice and interesting town and the stay of the hotel Romantic made big part of our unforgettable souvenir of our trip. I'll never chhos an other hotel to stay if I ever come back to Istanbul. Ahmed and Ylmaz, thank you and keep in touch!

Reviews.Title: “Big City, small room”
Reviews.Author: Brokendreams
Reviews.Content: Well you can't fault these guys for charm, effort, willingness to help, breakfast, location, views, comfort, cleanliness and authenticity of interior design, however I would say that the rooms and beds are on the small side. We wrote to the hotel separately upon reserving our room on lastminute.com and asked for a room with sea views as well as a king sized double bed. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly character - one of many who helped run the hotel - who spoke very good english, telling us that we had our room with a view and king size bed. I guess they just had smaller kings in Turkey than in England. And around the beds there wasn't too much room to do much else other than wake-up, change and leave, get home, unchange and get straight into bed. But although small the bed was very comfortable, like the room itself and the bathroom. We loved our time in Istanbul and the Romantic Hotel (you can't help but get close in that sized bed) contributed significantly to our enjoyment. Go when you can.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ahmoda
Reviews.Content: We ( my wife and I) just came back from a 5 day trip to Istanbul. We have chosen the Romantic Hotel after an extensive search on the Internet, we were looking for a hotel that fits our budget without compromising on the quality and comfort of our stay. In the Romantic Hotel, we had it all and more ! The hotel itself is a wonderful small boutique hotel that is elegantly decorated. Hotel staff, Yilmaz and Ahmed were very nice, friendly and helpful. I asked for a fruit basket with a note from me to my wife (as we were celebrating a special occasion) and they provided it free of charge. And on the day of our departure, Yilmaz arrived a little earlier than the start time of his shift just to say good bye to us. Also they have well arranged the shuttle from and to the airport in a comfortable car. We stayed in two rooms during our stay because the sea view room was not available for the first 2 nights (we were well informed of that before making the booking). Both rooms were absolutely beautiful, especially the room in the back side of the hotel which had a balcony with a magnificent view of the Marmara sea. The rooms were small but that is the case for nearly all the similar hotels in the area, they were cleaned everyday and towels were changed everyday. The heating system was working properly and the shower had a good flow of warm water, which was something we appreciated every night after a long stroll in the cold city. The breakfast served every morning was basic but delicious, it contained; boiled eggs, cheese, mortadella, butter, jam, honey, fresh Turkish bread, olives, corn flex, nuts and dried fruits, plus American coffee and tea. Also espresso coffee is available (but itâ€™s not for free) The hotel is within 5 minutes walk to all the major attractions in Sultanahmet area, Blue Mosque, Aiya Sophia, and Top Kapi palace. Also there are grocery shops, restaurants and a tramway station nearby. The hotel was recently renovated, so unlike the case with some other hotels, when you see pictures of the hotel that doesnâ€™t reflect the reality, the rooms in reality are not different from the pictures you see on the hotel website.
