The Romantic hotel is the place to stay in, if you are looking for a cozy place with a superior service in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaybuckz
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonably priced hotel in a good location, with simple rooms this is the place. Breakfast could be improved. What we want when travelling is a clean place to sleep in, in a central location (location is key for us) and this was fine. The rooms are small (apart from the top room which is massive!) It is within walking distance of everything and has views of the Marmaris and Bosphorous from the roof terrace. Very friendly staff. Make sure the air con is working and get them to show you how to use it!!

Reviews.Title: “Amaaazzing stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Johnybrasco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel last month and absolutely loved it! The location is wonderful..all the major tourist spots are within walking distance.The hotel is charming and well maintained..the hotel manager Yilmaz and the entire staff are very friendly and helpful.We were upgraded to the Dolmabahce Suite which is beautiful! We loved Istanbul and our stay in the Romantic Hotel made it a lovely holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel - The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieTurtle
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I had the privilege of staying at the Hotel Romantic located on the Sultanhamet in Istanbul. With views of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque in one direction and the Sea of Marmara in the other, we couldn't think of a better place to explore this vibrant city. We were made more than welcome by Yilmaz on arrival and immediately felt part of the "Romantic Hotel Family". Infact all the staff really went out of their way to ensure our stay was as pleasant as possible and that we were able to make the most of our time with them. We found the hotel very handy to all the historic buildings such as Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern to name a few. But equally important was its proximity to the tram, rail and City Explorer buses if we wanted to go further. We walked along the waterfront and explored the Hareem garden easily and always found time to unwind on the rooftop terrace and take in the views with a cold drink as the sun went down - beautiful. The hotel was very clean and has been tastefully decorated by the 3 sisters with a large variety of paintings and sculptures throughout accenting the hand painted furniture. Breakfast was served daily and we were spoilt for choice with a good range of food. We even took breakfast up on the terrace. The hotel is also surrounded by a variety of restaurants with different menu options so you don't have to travel far if you don't want to. We would recommend this hotel unreservedly as a comfortable base to immerse yourself in Turkish hospitality - enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: mkm1013
Reviews.Content: A great location from which to explore the beautiful and friendly city of Istanbul. I stayed three nights returning from a trip into Ukraine. The room was small but nicely decorated and very clean. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The three nights came with a free half-day tour, which turned into almost the entire day with my own personal guide. Free internet service and a very nice traditional European breakfast were also included. The hotel is a very short walk to the Blue Mosque and Haggia Sophia. There are many good restuarants and shops nearby. It is a city center location, so expect street noise. but it just added to the ambiance. The hotel picked me up from Ataturk for free, and I located a 4EU shuttle for my early flight out in a hole in the wall office. Don't bother with a taxi, the shuttle from yumetours was great. The Grand Bazarre was fun as was the trip on the ferry to the Asian side of the city. Istanbul ranks up with London and Athens as great places to visit. I am not a big chain, lots of amenities traveler. The boutique places are where you get to experience the culture and heart of a city. I plan to fly through IST again and will definitely stay with Romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: hongkongzoe
Reviews.Content: The people who work and run this hotel are what made this stay a good one. They were warm, hospitable and very welcoming, despite a few problems cropping up. I had booked three months in advance and asked for a 'delux double room with view and baby cot' and had also paid in advance. I had a confirmation by email and also phoned to double check that the cot could be provided. On arrival int he evening we were really disappointed to be shown to a small twin room, with no baby cot. After a long day this was a real let down. However, a cot was quickly found, but we were really cramped and there was not enough room to swing a cat! The hotel was fully booked and we could not be offered an alternative until the next day. After a pretty restless night the staff more than made up for the mix up the day before. They offered us a family room, with lots of space. The rooms are all decorated in quite a 'turkish' style...think chintz and frills and lots of them. All the rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were icredibley friendly and made a huge fuss of our 18 month old daughter. They were really helpful with everything from transport to organising getting some laundry done. The website we booked through gave a list of features this hotel had which didn't match reality, just minor things, but annoying if you were expecting them and they didn't materialise... the wifi didn't work, there were no dvd/cd players in the rooms , nor were there tea or coffee making facilities... The location was excellent, right in the heart of the action, lovely bars and restaurants a stone's throw away...very touristy...be prepared for tourist prices. But a very convenient location.... Good breakfast, turkish style, lots of choice and time to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaAlan
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights.First night given a small room off lobby, not allowing much privacy. The hotel changed it to a far better room for the other two nights. Hotel is in an excellent location for seeing the main sites of Sultanahmet and only about twenty minutes walk to trams. Rooms are clean and adequate. Considering the now high price of hotels in this area the hotel provides very good value. Breakfast is included and a reasonable choice provided.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay at the Romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: guineapiglet
Reviews.Content: Loveliest, coziest and cleanest hotel I have been to. The hotel is in a nice location, namely Sultanahmet, with all the important sights (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, German fountain, grand bazar,Topkapi museum, archeology museum,..) in walking distance. The tram is only 7 walking- minutes away from the hotel. There are a lot of restaurants and cafes in the area so that you have enough places to go at night. The hotel seems to have been renovated lately. The style of the interior is quite constant.. a lot of love and time has been invested into the details of the decoration. The room we stayed in was rather small and the entrance was right beside the reception, nevertheless we didn't feel disturbed. The service was great. All the staff members were very polite and tried to help. The room was always tidy, the towels were changed daily during our 5 day stay. The breakfast was rather turkish but cereals were available as well. The quality of the breakfast was good and you could eat as much as you want. Unfortunately we ended up getting a two bed room instead of a double bed but it was no problem pushing the beds together. I recommend this hotel for people who like sightseeing and having a homely feeling. It's ideal for couples especially older ones.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull weekend”
Reviews.Author: vita1936
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Istanbul in this hotel. The room was very comfortable with a beautifull view on the sea. The location is very practical, a few minutes from the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Museums. Breakfast is very rich and varied. The staff is kind and helpful. The only problem is to find it. Very few people know it, even taxi drivers. My advice is to print a plan

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome, Nice Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Yvo245
Reviews.Content: We are a married couple and a lively 6 year old that stayed at the Romantic Hotel for 4 nights in September. The welcome we received was very friendly and were given all the information we needed about the area. The staff were very friendly and playful with our daughter. There was less of a hotel feel and more of a homely feel to the place which we liked. We booked the Family Suite which comprised of two bedrooms and a bathroom. They were decorated nicely, if not a bit quirky, and very clean. The location of the hotel in relation to the main tourist/historic attractions in Istanbul is excellent. Literally 5-10 mins walk from it all. Small supermarkets around the corner for water, snacks etc. And good reasonable tourist restaurants close by. The roof top terrace has uninterrupted views. Really amazing at sunset and more could be made of this space in our opinion as we really enjoyed sitting up there in between sight seeing. Young party-goers may prefer somewhere in the vibrant new city area, but highly recommended for a short stay in Istanbul as great place close to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Experience of Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: claady
Reviews.Content: "I and my husband stayed in this small, lovely boutique hotel 2 weeks ago and loved it. It was a real experience of Turkish Hospitality for us. The all staff made us completely feel at home during our vacation. We spent 5 days in Dolmabahce Suite. The room was perfectly decoretad as you can see from the hotel's webpage and has a wide view of the Bosphorus and the Islands. The breakfast was delicious with a large open buffet with fresh and dried fruits, drinks and of course a big variety of Turkish breakfast stuff.. Simply, we recommend this hotel for their hospitality, service, location of course, and the atmosphere of the place. Thank you for everything guys.. See you next time ;))) Claire - Tennessee "

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wished for”
Reviews.Author: AvonTravellers
Reviews.Content: The Romantic Hotel is a small, wonderful, peaceful haven in the heart of the Sulanahmet with easy access to everything we had come to see and experience. After a long exciting journey across Europe we arrived and were instantly made to feel welcome and at home by the kind staff. Over our stay their help and advice was greatly appreciated. The hotel is well cared for with a lovely dining room which serves an excellent breakfast. Our room was beautifully set out and someone had gone to a lot of trouble to make the best of the space and then appealing to the eye. The roof garden, with its magnificent view of the Blue Mosque and the entrance to the Bosphorus, was a wonderful place to sit, both in the day and during the evening. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Mille et une Nuits”
Reviews.Author: REGGY8
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Romantic Hotel during one week has highly contributed to make our dream come true. We have been wishing to visit Istanbul for many years, the travel agent proposed Romantic Hotel as an option and it rapidly proved to be a shelter at night after days spent at walking for hours to discover this marvellous but teeming town. The hotel is located in the middle of the historical area. The staff has provided friendly but efficient and professional services. We will return to Romantic Hotel next times we go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: sofipink
Reviews.Content: great location, great staff. rooms very clean and very cute, will deffinatly go back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: newyorkmolly
Reviews.Content: Great location and welcoming staff. The hotel is clean and quiet. Check out the fabulous views from the roof garden.

HotelInfo.Name: Romantic Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Mimar Mehmet Aga Cad Amiral Tafdil Sok No 29 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
